document.ModsDocTitle: A revision of the Larainae (Coleoptera, Elmidae) of Venezuela, with description of nine new species
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Larainae (Coleoptera, Elmidae) of Venezuela, with description of nine new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Larainae (Coleoptera, Elmidae) of Venezuela, with description of nine new species

subSubSection.paragraph: For complete redescription and genitalia illustrations, see Spangler and Santiago-Fragoso 1992 .

Phanocerus congener can be separated from all other species of Phanocerus by the following combination of characters: pronotum wide, 1.4x as wide as long, with wide anterolateral angles which are explanate (Fig. 71). Additionally, the setose patch at the base of the mesotibia of the male is long (Fig. 69).
Slight variations in size (2.1-2.5 mm) and color (light to dark brown) are common in Phanocerus congener .

This species has previously only been known from the Lesser Antilles, but is actually widespread in Venezuela, found throughout Western Venezuela in the Merida Andes and the coastal ranges (Fig. 7). The habitat of Phanocerus congener is similar to that of other Phanocerus species, in partially submerged leaf packs and woody debris.

Hexanchorus falconensis sp. n. was collected at Cataratas del Hueque along with Phanocerus congener , in addition to Heterelmis spp., and Microcylloepus spp., Lutrochus acuminatus ( Lutrochidae ) ( Maier and Short 2013 ), and larvae of Psephenidae .
